title: Lucifer finale: Tom Ellis teases musical episode in suave BTS clip
text:
Lucifer star Tom Ellis has teased the musical episode of season five with a video that’s giving off strong Singin’ In The Rain vibes.

In the final season we’ll get to hear the vocal talents of Tom and the rest of the cast in an episode with a difference.

And we might be seeing their dancing skills too if this video featuring the actor is anything to go by.

Tom, who plays the titular character, appears in a sweet behind-the-scenes clip from season five showing off his moves.

In a nod to the classic Gene Kelly musical, he brandishes an umbrella and wears a trilby hat and tuxedo as he smoothly dances his way around the set.

Posting the fun footage on Instagram, he said: ‘We had so much fun shooting episode 4 of #Luciferseason5 In between takes I found an umbrella and made this video with the ever imaginative @joshstyle sometimes I love my job. Other times I can’t believe it’s a job. #lucky #lucifer.’

It comes after Lucifans were treated to the first look at Tom’s duet with Lesley-Ann Brandt in the episode.

Shot entirely in black and white, it will be set in alternate universe from the 1940s.

Lucifer and Lesley’s character Mazkieen are going to make sweet music together on the show, as this classy picture of them sat behind a piano shows.

‘I would say on this episode, we take a trip down memory lane with Lucifer,’ Tom spilled to Entertainment Weekly about the musical. ‘We tell a story that answers the question a lot of fans have been asking actually.

‘The lovely thing about this episode is you see a lot of our regular characters in a different light. There’s an element to Lucifer where he seems to be from the Oscar Wilde period. And to see the other characters fall back into that style is quite interesting.’

There’s also a chance that none other than singer Kelly Clarkson might make an appearance, as she was recently spotted on set and is a massive fan of the show.

Lucifer seasons one to three are available on Amazon Prime while season 4 is on Netflix.
